main event: A bright shiny, silvery, metallic appearing saucer-shaped object was observed hovering in Elko, Nevada on 20 August 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as being about 20-25 feet in diameter and exhibited a jerking motion while hovering., The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes., The observation was made by two witnesses while tracking a pilot balloon., The object moved from directly overhead to the north and disappeared from view., The angular movement during tracking confirmed it was not fluctuating.
sighted object: a bright shiny, metallic saucer-shaped object
witness description: Observers of a pilot balloon ascent
